message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.SE, cs.AI 

The paper proposes a neural architecture for detecting duplicate bug reports and clustering them into latent topics. This involves natural language processing (NLP) techniques such as self-attention and conditional attention. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). Additionally, the paper deals with information retrieval (IR) tasks such as topic clustering and duplicate detection, which makes cs.IR (Information Retrieval) another likely sub-category. The paper also uses machine learning techniques such as loss functions and neural networks, which fall under cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper is also related to software engineering (cs.SE) as it deals with bug reports and their management. Finally, the paper involves unsupervised learning, which is a sub-field of artificial intelligence (cs.AI).
